description:
60 Minute Runtime: Extended cleaning sessions
Lightweight at 1.6kg: Easy to carry and manoeuvre
Converts from Upright to Handheld: Clean stairs and upholstery easily
Easy-Empty Dust Tray: Simple disposal
Detachable Duster: Quickly clean walls and tops of furniture
Troubleshooting:
1. “My SW02 is not charging. What should I do?”

Answer:
Please ensure the charger is fully pushed into the charging port.
The indicator light should turn on when charging starts.
Try a different plug socket.
If there is still no light, the charger or battery may be faulty and we can arrange a replacement.

2. “The sweeper is fully charged but only runs for a short time.”

Answer:
This normally means the battery is no longer holding charge.
Please charge the SW02 for at least 4 hours.
If runtime remains low, the battery may need replacing under warranty.

3. “The brush bar isn’t rotating.”

Answer:
The brush bar may be blocked by hair or debris.
Turn off the sweeper, remove the brush bar and clean it thoroughly.
If the brush still doesn’t rotate, the motor may require inspection.

4. “My SW02 is not picking up dirt properly.”

Answer:
Please check that:

The dirt tray is empty

The brush bar is clean

There is no blockage near the roller
If the issue continues, the brush bar may be worn and need replacing.

5. “The sweeper is making a loud or strange noise.”

Answer:
Unusual noise usually means something is trapped in the brush bar or wheels.
Turn the unit off and remove any debris.
If noise continues, the motor or wheel assembly may need repair.

6. “How do I empty the dirt tray?”

Answer:
Lift the sweeper and slide the dirt tray out from underneath.
Empty it into the bin and slide it back until it clicks.

7. “The handle feels loose or wobbly.”

Answer:
Please ensure the handle is pushed firmly into the body until it locks.
If it still feels loose, the handle may need replacing.

8. “Can I use the SW02 on hard floors?”

Answer:
Yes, the SW02 is suitable for carpets, rugs, wood, laminate and most hard floors.
Avoid very uneven or deep-pile surfaces.

9. “It’s pushing dirt around instead of collecting it.”

Answer:
This may happen if the brush bar is full or the dirt tray is not fully closed.
Please clean the brush and ensure the tray is fully inserted.
If the issue continues, a new brush bar may be required.

10. “The wheels are stiff or not rolling smoothly.”

Answer:
Hair or debris may be wrapped around the wheels.
Turn the sweeper upside down and remove any obstructions.
If a wheel is damaged, we can arrange a replacement.

11. “Do you sell spare parts for the SW02?”

Answer:
Yes, we offer replacement brush bars, handles and chargers.
I can help you order the correct part.

12. “What is the warranty on the SW02?”

Answer:
The SW02 comes with a 2-year warranty from the date of purchase.
We’re happy to repair or replace any faulty parts within this period.

13. “Can I return the sweeper if I don’t like it?”

Answer:
Yes, we offer a 30-day home trial.
If you're not fully satisfied, you can return the sweeper for a refund.

14. “Why does the sweeper stop when used on thick carpets?”

Answer:
Deep-pile carpets can create extra resistance.
Please use slower strokes or test on a different section.
Cleaning or replacing the brush bar may also help.

15. “How do I clean the brush bar?”

Answer:
Remove the brush bar, cut away tangled hair or threads, and wipe clean with a dry cloth.
Ensure it clicks securely back into place before use.

Remove the brush bar, clear any tangled fibres, wipe it clean and refit until it clicks.

description:

Troubleshooting:
1. “My HyLite 2 is not turning on. What should I do?”

Answer:
Please check that the battery is fully inserted until it clicks.
Try charging it for at least 4 hours and then test again.
If it still won’t turn on, the battery or motor may need inspection.

2. “The suction is very weak or poor.”

Answer:
Weak suction usually means restricted airflow.
Please check:

The dust bag is not full

The bag is fitted correctly

The air path is clear

The brush bar is clean
If suction remains low, the bag or brush bar may need replacing.

3. “The brush bar isn’t spinning.”

Answer:
Please turn off the vacuum and remove any hair or debris from the brush bar.
Restart the machine.
If the brush still doesn’t spin, the belt or motor may require servicing.

4. “My HyLite 2 keeps cutting out during use.”

Answer:
This usually happens when the vacuum overheats due to a blockage.
Please clean the brush bar, clear the airway and check the bag.
Allow the unit to cool for 30 minutes before using again.

5. “The battery doesn’t last as long as it used to.”

Answer:
Short runtime often means the battery is ageing or airflow is restricted.
Please clean the brush bar and empty the dust bag.
If runtime remains low, the battery may need replacing.

6. “The vacuum is making a loud or strange noise.”

Answer:
This usually indicates something trapped in the brush bar or airway.
Turn the unit off and remove any debris.
If the noise continues, the brush housing or motor may need inspection.

7. “How do I change or remove the dust bag?”

Answer:
Open the top cover, remove the old bag and slide a new one in until it is secure.
Make sure the bag is fitted correctly to maintain performance.

8. “The LED lights are not turning on.”

Answer:
Please ensure the vacuum head is properly connected.
Dust on the contact points may affect the lights — clean gently if needed.
If the lights still don’t work, the head may need replacing.

9. “The HyLite 2 isn’t picking up dirt.”

Answer:
Please check:

The bag is correctly installed

The brush bar is spinning

The air path is clear
If pickup is still poor, the brush bar or belt may need replacing.

10. “The wheels feel stiff or not rolling smoothly.”

Answer:
Hair or fibres may be stuck around the wheels.
Turn the vacuum over and remove any debris.
If the wheel is damaged, we can arrange a replacement.

11. “Is the HyLite 2 safe for hard floors?”

Answer:
Yes, it is suitable for carpets and most hard floors.
Avoid very uneven stone or rough surfaces to prevent brush damage.

12. “My HyLite 2 turns off when I recline it.”

Answer:
This may happen if a part is not fully connected.
Please ensure:

The bag door is closed

The handle is locked in place

The head is fully attached

13. “The vacuum smells bad when in use.”

Answer:
This usually means the dust bag is full or damp.
Replace the bag and clean the brush bar.
If the smell persists, the internal filter system may need attention.

14. “Why is dust escaping from the vacuum?”

Answer:
Dust leakage usually means the bag is not fitted correctly.
Please remove and reinstall the bag firmly.
Replace it if damaged or full.

15. “Can I wash the filter?”

Answer:
No, the HyLite 2 uses disposable dust bags and does not have a washable filter.
Replacing the bag usually restores airflow and performance.

16. “What is the warranty for the HyLite 2?”

Answer:
The HyLite 2 comes with a 2-year warranty.
If you experience any faults, we can arrange repair or replacement.

Troubleshooting:
1. “My AirRam Platinum is not turning on.”

Answer:
Please remove the battery and reinsert it until it clicks.
Charge it for at least 4 hours and try again.
If the unit still doesn’t power on, the battery or motor may need inspection.

2. “The suction is weak or not picking up well.”

Answer:
Please check that the bin is empty, the filter is clean and there are no blockages in the air path.
A dirty filter is the most common cause — washing and fully drying it usually restores performance.

3. “The Anti-Hair Wrap brush is not spinning.”

Answer:
Please switch off the vacuum and remove any tangled hair or threads around the brush.
Restart the vacuum.
If the brush still doesn’t spin, the drive mechanism may need servicing.

4. “My AirRam Platinum keeps stopping during use.”

Answer:
This often happens when the machine overheats due to a blockage.
Please clean the brush bar, empty the bin and clean the filter.
Allow the machine to cool before using again.

5. “The battery doesn’t last long.”

Answer:
Short runtime may indicate a blocked filter, heavy debris load or an ageing battery.
Please clean the filter fully and recharge the battery.
If runtime remains short, the battery may need replacing.

6. “It’s making a loud or unusual noise.”

Answer:
A loud noise usually means something is caught in the brush bar or airway.
Turn the vacuum off and check for debris.
If the noise continues, the motor or brush head may need inspection.

7. “The Anti-Hair Wrap feature doesn’t seem to be working.”

Answer:
Please make sure the brush bar is clean and free from long hair strands.
The feature reduces tangling but cannot prevent all hair wrap.
If the brush is constantly tangling, the brush bar may need replacing.

8. “The headlights stopped working.”

Answer:
Please check the head connection for dust and ensure the battery is charged.
If the lights still don’t come on, the head unit may need replacing.

9. “Dust is escaping from the vacuum.”

Answer:
Dust leakage usually means the bin or filter is not fitted correctly.
Remove and refit both parts securely.
If dust continues escaping, the filter may need replacement.

10. “The vacuum is hard to push on carpets.”

Answer:
Please check the brush bar for tangled hair and ensure the filter is clean.
Deep carpets can also increase resistance.
If it still feels heavy, the brush head may need inspection.

11. “My AirRam Platinum is leaving lines or patches on the floor.”

Answer:
This can happen when the filter or brush bar needs cleaning.
Please clean both and try again.
If the issue continues, the brush bar may be worn.

12. “How do I clean the filter?”

Answer:
Remove the filter, rinse it under cold water and allow it to dry for 24 hours before refitting.
Do not use the machine with a damp filter.

13. “The vacuum won’t stand upright.”

Answer:
Please ensure the hinge clicks into the upright position.
If it doesn’t lock, the hinge mechanism may need replacement.

14. “There’s a burning smell when I use it.”

Answer:
Please turn the vacuum off immediately.
This usually means the brush bar is jammed.
Clean it thoroughly.
If the smell continues, the motor may need inspection.

15. “What is the warranty for the AirRam Platinum?”

Answer:
The AirRam Platinum comes with a 2-year warranty.
We can arrange repair or replacement if any faults appear.

description:
40 Minute Runtime: Complete all hard floors in one session
Charging Base: Keep your Orca powered and ready to go

Troubleshooting:
1. “My Orca is not turning on.”

Answer:
Please ensure the battery is fully inserted until it clicks.
Charge the unit for at least 4 hours.
If it still does not turn on, the battery or motor may need inspection.

2. “The Orca is not picking up water or debris.”

Answer:
Please check:

The brush roller is clean

The water tank is filled

The suction path is not blocked
Cleaning the roller and removing obstructions usually fixes the issue.

3. “The brush roller is not rotating.”

Answer:
Turn the unit off and check for hair or debris wrapped around the roller.
Remove any tangles.
If the roller still won’t spin, the drive mechanism may need servicing.

4. “The Orca leaves streaks or smears on the floor.”

Answer:
Streaks can be caused by:

A dirty brush roller

Using too much cleaning solution

Low water levels
Clean the roller and refill the tank with clean water.

5. “The dirty water tank is not collecting water.”

Answer:
Please check:

The tank is fitted correctly

The float valve is not stuck

The suction channel is not blocked
Empty and refit the tank if needed.

6. “The Orca is leaking water.”

Answer:
Leaks may occur if:

The clean water tank is not sealed

The tank lid is loose

The unit is tipped too far back or forward
Ensure the tank is firmly fitted and upright.

7. “The battery isn’t charging.”

Answer:
Make sure the charger is connected properly and the LED light comes on.
Try a different socket.
If no lights appear, the battery or charger may be faulty.

8. “The runtime is shorter than expected.”

Answer:
Short runtime may be caused by:

A clogged brush roller

Blocked suction path

An ageing battery
Clean the roller and filter, then test again.

9. “The Orca is making a loud or unusual noise.”

Answer:
This usually means debris is stuck in the roller, suction area or dirty water tank.
Turn off the unit and remove any obstructions.

10. “How do I clean the brush roller?”

Answer:
Remove the brush cover, take out the roller and rinse it under cold water.
Allow it to dry fully before refitting.

11. “How often should I change the cleaning solution?”

Answer:
Empty and refill the clean water tank after every use.
Do not leave solution in the tank for long periods.

12. “The Orca leaves the floor too wet.”

Answer:
This may happen if:

The dirty water tank is full

The suction path is blocked

The roller is over-saturated
Empty the dirty water tank and clean the suction area.

13. “Can I use the Orca on carpets or rugs?”

Answer:
No — the Orca is designed only for sealed hard floors such as tile, laminate, vinyl and hardwood.

14. “The dirty water tank smells bad.”

Answer:
Please empty and rinse the tank after every use.
Let it dry before refitting.
Smells come from bacteria building up in damp areas.

15. “The floor looks dull after cleaning.”

Answer:
Try:

Cleaning the roller

Using less solution

Doing a second pass to remove residue
Dullness is usually caused by leftover dirt or excess detergent.

16. “The handle feels loose.”

Answer:
Ensure the handle is fully inserted and locked into place.
If it still feels loose, the locking mechanism may need inspection.

17. “The Orca stops during use.”

Answer:
This typically happens when:

The brush roller is jammed

The suction path is blocked

The battery is nearly empty
Clean the roller and allow the machine to cool before restarting.

18. “My Orca arrived damaged.”

Answer:
Please contact support.
We can arrange a replacement or repair if it arrived with physical damage.

19. “What is the warranty for the Orca?”

Answer:
The Gtech Orca includes a 2-year warranty.
We can repair or replace any faulty components during this period.

Body Only: Interchangeable battery with GT50, LHT50 or HT50

Already own a GT50, LHT50 or HT50? Use this SLM50 (body only) unit with your GT50, LHT50 or HT50 battery and charger to expand your garden range at an affordable price.

Don't own a GT50, LHT50 or HT50? Select the GT50 or HT50 which includes a battery and charger
Troubleshooting:
1. “What is included with the SLM50 Body Only?”

Answer:
The Body Only version includes the mower body and blade assembly.
It does not include the battery, charger, or grass box.

2. “Will my existing SLM50 battery work with this body?”

Answer:
Yes — this replacement body is compatible with all SLM50 batteries and chargers.

3. “Does the Body Only come with a grass box?”

Answer:
No, the grass box is not included.
You can reuse your existing grass box or purchase one separately.

4. “Does this Body Only come with a blade?”

Answer:
Yes — a cutting blade is pre-fitted to the mower body.

5. “My old mower body is cracked. Is this the correct replacement?”

Answer:
Yes — this is the official replacement body for the SLM50 Small Lawnmower.

6. “Can I use this Body Only to upgrade from another model?”

Answer:
No — it is designed specifically for the SLM50.
It is not compatible with other Gtech lawnmower models.

7. “Why does the mower not turn on after installing the new body?”

Answer:
Please ensure:

The battery is fully charged

The battery is inserted correctly

The safety key (if applicable) is fitted
If it still doesn’t turn on, the issue may be with the battery, not the mower body.

8. “Does this Body Only come with a battery?”

Answer:
No — the battery and charger must be purchased separately or used from your existing SLM50.

9. “Is the handle included in the Body Only version?”

Answer:
The lower handle is part of the body assembly.
The upper handle must be reused from your current mower or purchased separately.

10. “Can I fit my existing blade onto this new body?”

Answer:
Yes — the mower accepts standard SLM50 blades.
However, a new blade is supplied pre-installed.

11. “Is the SLM50 Body Only easy to assemble?”

Answer:
Yes — simply attach your existing handle, battery and grass box.
No tools are usually required.

12. “The new body vibrates more than my old one.”

Answer:
Please check:

The blade is tightened correctly

The blade is not bent or damaged

The grass box is fitted properly
If vibration continues, the blade may need replacing.

13. “The cut height seems wrong. Is the body faulty?”

Answer:
Cut height is controlled by the height adjuster.
Ensure the adjuster moves freely and clicks into each position.
The body itself does not affect cut height.

14. “Can I use this SLM50 Body Only for commercial gardening?”

Answer:
The SLM50 is designed for domestic use only, not commercial or heavy-duty tasks.

15. “What is the warranty on the SLM50 Body Only?”

Answer:
The replacement body includes a 2-year warranty covering manufacturing faults.

16. “My new Body Only arrived damaged — what should I do?”

Answer:
Please contact support.
We can arrange a replacement if it arrived with physical damage.

17. “Is this Body Only lighter or heavier than the original?”

Answer:
It is the same weight and specification as the original SLM50 mower body.

18. “Can I use the mower without the grass box?”

Answer:
Yes — the mower will operate without a grass box, but cuttings may eject from the rear.

Answer:
Please ensure the battery is fully charged and inserted until it clicks.

If it still won’t turn on, the battery or mower motor may need inspection.

2. “The mower stops during use.”

Answer:
This often happens when:

The blade is jammed

Grass is blocking the underside

The motor overheats
Turn off the mower, clear debris and allow it to cool before restarting.

3. “The battery isn’t charging.”

Answer:
Ensure the charger is fully connected and the LED lights come on.
Try a different socket.
If no lights appear, the charger or battery may be faulty.

4. “The runtime is too short.”

Answer:
Short runtime may be caused by:

Thick or wet grass increasing load

A dull or damaged blade

An ageing battery
Sharpening or replacing the blade can improve runtime.

5. “The mower is not cutting grass evenly.”

Answer:
Please check:

The blade is sharp and not damaged

The cutting height is set evenly

The grass box is not overfilled
A damaged or dull blade should be replaced.

6. “How do I adjust the cutting height?”

Answer:
Use the height adjustment lever on the side of the mower.
Select the desired height and ensure it clicks into place.

7. “The blade isn’t spinning.”

Answer:
Turn off the mower and check for:

Grass or debris blocking the blade

A loose or damaged blade
If the blade is secure and clear but still not spinning, the motor may need inspection.

8. “The mower is very hard to push.”

Answer:
Grass buildup under the deck can increase resistance.
Turn off the mower and clear the underside.
Also check that the wheels move freely.

9. “The mower is leaving clumps of grass behind.”

Answer:
This may happen if:

The grass is too long or wet

The grass box is full

The blade is dull
Empty the grass box and consider raising the cutting height.

10. “The mower feels weak on thicker patches of grass.”

Answer:
Try raising the cutting height and doing multiple passes.
Thick or wet grass can reduce performance.

11. “The grass box keeps falling off.”

Answer:
Ensure the box is aligned properly and clicked firmly into place.
If the latches are worn or damaged, the box may need replacing.

12. “The mower is making a loud noise.”

Answer:
Loud noises usually indicate:

A loose blade

A bent or damaged blade

Debris stuck underneath
Turn off the mower and inspect the blade area.

13. “Is the SLM50 suitable for uneven lawns?”

Answer:
The SLM50 is best for small, relatively even lawns.
Very uneven ground may affect cutting performance.

14. “Can I cut wet grass?”

Answer:
We recommend avoiding wet grass.
It reduces cutting efficiency, shortens runtime and may clog the mower.

15. “Can I buy a spare blade for the SLM50?”

Answer:
Yes — replacement blades are available and easy to fit.

16. “The mower vibrates strongly when running.”

Answer:
Strong vibration usually means the blade is bent, loose or unbalanced.
Please check and replace the blade if damaged.

17. “What comes in the box with the SLM50?”

Answer:
The full mower includes:

SLM50 mower body

Grass box

Battery

Charger

Blade (pre-fitted)

Please contact support.

The SLM50 Small Lawnmower comes with a 2-year warranty covering manufacturing faults.

Answer:
Please ensure the battery is fully charged and inserted until it clicks.

Answer:
Check that the charger is connected properly and the LED light turns on.
Try a different plug socket.
If no lights appear, the charger or battery may be faulty.

3. “The drill stops during use.”

Answer:
This can happen when:

The drill is overloaded

The clutch slips

The battery is low
Reduce pressure on the drill or change the torque setting.

4. “The drill won’t drill into a wall.”

Answer:
Please check:

You are using the correct hammer mode

You are using a masonry drill bit

The battery has enough charge
If the drill still struggles, the bit may be worn.

Answer:
Ensure the drill is in lock mode by releasing the trigger.

Answer:
Increase the torque setting.
If the clutch clicks rapidly, the torque may be too low.

7. “The drill makes a burning smell.”

Answer:
Stop using it immediately.

Motor overheating

Using the wrong mode

Overloading the drill
Let it cool for 10–15 minutes and use a lower speed.

8. “Which mode should I use?”

Answer:

Drill mode → making holes in wood, plastic, metal

Screw mode → driving screws (with torque control)

Hammer mode → drilling into brick or masonry

9. “What are the two speeds for?”

Answer:

Low speed / high torque → screwdriving, large drill bits

High speed / low torque → drilling smaller holes

10. “The drill bit keeps falling out.”

Answer:
Ensure the chuck is fully tightened.
Turn the chuck clockwise until it locks.
If it still slips, the bit may be worn or the chuck may need inspection.

Answer:
Yes — the drill accepts most standard drill and screwdriver bits.

The bit is bent or damaged

Drilling into hard materials

Using hammer mode continuously

Low temperatures
Fully recharge the battery and avoid overloading the drill.

A full charge typically takes 3–4 hours depending on charger type.

Carry case

Answer:
Please ensure the battery is fully charged and inserted until it clicks.
Remove and reinsert the battery to check contact.

Answer:
Make sure the charger is plugged in properly and the LED lights turn on.
Try a different socket.
If there’s still no light, the charger or battery may be faulty.

Answer:

You are using the correct impact bit

The screw is not too long or too tight for the material

The battery has enough charge
Impact drivers don’t have a clutch — control is applied using trigger pressure.

4. “The bit keeps slipping or falling out.”

Answer:
Ensure the bit is fully inserted into the quick-release chuck until it locks.
If the bit falls out easily, try a new bit, as worn bits won’t seat properly.

Answer:
Yes — impact drivers are louder than combi drills due to the internal hammer mechanism.
However, excessive grinding noise may indicate a damaged bit or blockage in the chuck.

6. “The driver stops or struggles on heavy-duty screws.”

Answer:
This may happen when:

The screw is too large for the material

The battery is low

The bit is worn or overheating
Try a new bit or recharge the battery.

7. “The vibration feels very strong.”

Answer:
Strong vibration occurs if:

The bit is bent

The bit is worn

The screw is misaligned
Replace the bit and ensure proper screw alignment.

8. “What modes does the Impact Driver have?”

Answer:
Impact drivers have one primary mode: impact fastening.
Speed and torque are controlled by how hard you press the trigger.

9. “Can I drill holes with the Impact Driver?”

Answer:
It is designed for driving screws and bolts, not precision drilling.
Use the Gtech Combi Drill for drilling tasks.

10. “The bit is stuck in the quick-release chuck.”

Answer:
Pull the collar fully forward while pulling the bit out.
If it still won’t release, debris may need to be cleaned from the chuck.

11. “The battery drains quickly when driving large screws.”

Answer:
Impact driving uses more power than regular drilling.
Runtime decreases when working with:

Long screws

Dense hardwood

Metal fixings
Swap in a spare battery if needed.

12. “How long does the battery take to charge?”

Answer:
A full charge typically takes 3–4 hours depending on charger type.

13. “What comes in the Black/Gold Impact Driver Bundle?”

Answer:

Impact Driver (Black/Gold)

Battery

Charger

Impact-rated screwdriver bits

Carry case
Contents may vary depending on the offer.

14. “Are the included bits impact-rated?”

Answer:
Yes — the bits supplied in the bundle are designed for impact loads.

15. “Can I use standard screwdriver bits?”

Answer:
You can, but impact-rated bits are recommended as they won’t snap under heavy torque.

16. “The driver is smoking or smells burnt.”

Answer:
Stop immediately.
This can occur when:

The bit is stuck

The screw is overtightened

The motor is overheating
Let it cool for 10–15 minutes and reduce pressure on the tool.

17. “Can it remove bolts?”

Answer:
Yes — impact drivers can loosen or tighten bolts when used with the correct impact socket adapter.

18. “Can I use the battery with other Gtech power tools?”

Answer:
Yes — the battery is compatible with select Gtech tools in the same range.

19. “My tool arrived damaged — what should I do?”

Answer:
Please contact support.
We can arrange a replacement or repair if it arrived damaged.

20. “What is the warranty for the Impact Driver?”

Answer:
The Impact Driver Bundle includes a 2-year warranty covering manufacturing faults.

21. “The impact driver is too powerful — how do I control it?”

Answer:
Apply gentle trigger pressure for low speed.
The more pressure applied, the more torque is delivered.

Answer:
Performance is the same.
The Black/Gold edition features a premium finish and upgraded bundle contents.

Using the wrong mode

A loose bit

Answer:

17. “The light isn’t working.”

Combi Drill (Black/Gold body only)

This is the clutch protecting the motor.

description:
Ionic Technology: Seals cuticles for smooth, shiny, frizz-free hair
Custom Control: 4 heat and 4 speed settings for perfect styling
Compact and Lightweight: Ideal for home or travel use
Powerful Motor: 110,000 RPM brushless design for fast, quiet drying
Magnetic Attachments: Includes diffuser and concentrator for versatile styling
Troubleshooting:
1. “My DryOnic hair dryer won’t turn on.”

Answer:
Please check the plug is fully inserted into the socket.
Try a different socket if possible.
If it still won’t turn on, the internal fuse or motor may need inspection.

2. “The dryer keeps turning off during use.”

Answer:
This usually happens when:

The dryer overheats

The filter is blocked

The airflow is restricted
Turn it off, let it cool, and clean the filter at the back.

3. “The airflow feels weak.”

Answer:
Weak airflow is usually caused by:

A blocked air filter

Hair or dust in the intake

A faulty motor
Remove and clean the filter thoroughly.

4. “The dryer is getting too hot.”

Answer:
Please check:

The filter is clean

The airflow is not blocked
If it still overheats, use a lower heat setting or let it cool between uses.

5. “What heat and speed settings does it have?”

Answer:
The DryOnic typically includes:

Multiple heat levels

Multiple airflow speeds

Cool shot function for styling

6. “Does the ionic function really help?”

Answer:
Yes — ionic technology helps reduce frizz and smooth the hair by breaking down water molecules more efficiently.

7. “The dryer smells like burning.”

Answer:
A brief smell during first use is normal.
If the smell continues, this may indicate dust on the heating coil or overheating.
Turn it off and clean the filter.

8. “The concentrator nozzle keeps falling off.”

Answer:
Ensure the nozzle is aligned correctly and pushed on firmly until secure.
If it still loosens, the attachment may need replacement.

9. “The cool shot button isn’t working.”

Answer:
Make sure the dryer is running on a heat setting before pressing cool shot.
If it still doesn’t activate, the internal switch may need inspection.

10. “The dryer is louder than expected.”

Answer:
Some noise is normal for high-power motors.
If the sound is unusually loud or rattling, check for debris in the filter.

11. “Is the dryer safe to use on coloured or damaged hair?”

Answer:
Yes — use lower heat settings for delicate or coloured hair to prevent damage.

12. “Can I use an extension lead with the hair dryer?”

Answer:
We recommend plugging it directly into a wall socket for safety.
If an extension is used, it must be rated for high-power appliances.

13. “The cord feels loose where it joins the dryer.”

Answer:
This may indicate wear in the strain-relief area.
Stop using it and request inspection.

14. “How do I clean the filter?”

Answer:
Twist or pull off the rear cover (depending on model), remove trapped dust and lint, and reinstall it securely.

15. “Does this model support a diffuser attachment?”

Answer:
The included attachments are shown on the product page.
If a diffuser is not listed, it is not supported.

16. “The airflow is pulsating.”

Answer:
This usually means the airflow path is blocked or the filter is dirty.
Cleaning the filter normally resolves it.

17. “Is the dryer dual-voltage for travel?”

Answer:
No — it is designed for UK voltage only.

18. “Can I use the dryer in the bathroom?”

Answer:
Yes, but only away from water sources and never near running water.
Always follow UK bathroom electrical safety guidelines.

19. “The colour looks different from the photos — is that normal?”

Answer:
Slight variations in shade can occur due to lighting or screen differences, but it should match the Teal colour specification.

20. “The dryer arrived damaged — what should I do?”

Answer:
Please contact support.
We can arrange a replacement or repair if it arrived damaged.

21. “What is the warranty on the DryOnic Hair Dryer?”

Answer:
The DryOnic Hair Dryer includes a 2-year warranty covering manufacturing faults.

22. “Is this hair dryer suitable for everyday use?”

Answer:
Yes — it is designed for fast, regular drying with ionic technology to protect hair.

This electric assist bike uses a battery to power the motor, so you can continue to pedal normally while moving more quickly and easily over a variety of terrains. With 2 modes to choose from, you’re in complete control.

Dynamic Saddle Design
Cross Bar Frame
Electric Assist
2 Speed Modes
Troubleshooting:
1. “My eBike Sport EB01 won’t turn on.”

Answer:
Please ensure the battery is fully charged and correctly inserted.
Check that the power button on the battery lights up.
If it still won’t power on, the battery or control unit may need inspection.

2. “The motor assistance isn’t working.”

Answer:
This usually happens when:

The battery is low

The pedal-assist sensor is dirty or misaligned

The wheel magnet is not detected
Ensure the magnet on the wheel is aligned with the sensor.

3. “The battery is not charging.”

Answer:
Check the charger light turns on when plugged in.
Try a different plug socket.
If the battery still won’t charge, it may need inspection or replacement.

4. “What is the battery range?”

Answer:
The EB01 typically provided a range of up to 30 miles, depending on terrain, rider weight, and power mode.

5. “The bike is losing power quickly.”

Answer:
Reduced range can be caused by:

An ageing battery

Cold weather

High power mode usage
If the range is much lower than before, the battery may be worn.

6. “Is the EB01 still supported?”

Answer:
Yes — although discontinued, the EB01 remains supported under its 5-year guarantee for qualifying customers.

7. “Can I still buy spare parts?”

Answer:
Many parts are now limited.
Availability depends on stock — support can confirm if the required part is still in supply.

8. “The power cuts out while riding.”

Answer:
This may happen if:

The battery loses connection

The pedal sensor signal is interrupted

The battery is low
Remove the battery, clean the contacts, and refit securely.

9. “The brakes feel weak.”

Answer:
Brake pads may need adjustment or replacement.
Check pad alignment and ensure the wheels are seated correctly.

10. “The gears are slipping.”

Answer:
Slipping gears usually mean the derailleur or cable needs adjustment.
Light lubrication on the chain may also help.

11. “The motor makes a clicking or grinding noise.”

Answer:
A loose spoke, misaligned wheel, or debris near the motor housing may cause noise.
Stop riding and inspect the rear wheel area.

12. “The display or battery indicator is flashing.”

Answer:
A flashing light may indicate low battery or a sensor error.
Try a full charge and check the wheel sensor alignment.

13. “Can I still claim warranty?”

Answer:
Yes — if within 5 years from the purchase date and covered under the original guarantee.

14. “Is the EB01 water-resistant?”

Answer:
It is suitable for normal rain, but not for full submersion or pressure-washing.

15. “The bike feels heavy to pedal without assistance.”

Answer:
E-bikes are heavier than standard bikes due to the motor and battery.
Using a lower gear can help when riding without power.

16. “The bike vibrates or feels unstable.”

Answer:
Please check:

Tyre pressure

Wheel alignment

Loose bolts on handlebars or seatpost
A quick mechanical check usually resolves this.

17. “How often should I charge the battery?”

Answer:
Charge after each ride if possible.
Do not leave the battery fully flat for long periods.

18. “Can I replace the battery with a new one?”

Answer:
Replacement batteries may be limited due to discontinuation.
Support can confirm availability based on current stock.

19. “My charger gets very hot.”

Answer:
Some warmth is normal.
If the charger becomes extremely hot or smells burnt, stop using it and contact support.

20. “The tyres keep losing air.”

Answer:
This usually means the inner tube is punctured or the valve is loose.
A puncture repair or tube replacement will resolve it.

21. “The EB01 arrived damaged.”

Answer:
If purchased within the warranty period, support can arrange a repair or replacement.

22. “Is the EB01 compatible with modern accessories?”

Answer:
Most standard bike accessories (lights, bags, mudguards) are compatible, but electrical upgrades are not supported.
